intro: Delopyrum basiramia, commonly known as the Basiramia sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or brown in color. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various small organisms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in parts of its native range.
